item.title: UN Agency Rules Russia Shot Down Malaysian Passenger Jet in 2014
item.description: The UN’s aviation council ruled on Monday that Russia was responsible for the 2014 downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 that killed all 298 passengers and crew, including more than 200 Dutch and Australian citizens.
item.dc:creator: Philip Heijmans

media:content.media:description: GRABOVO, UKRAINE - JULY 22: Wreckage from Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 lies in a field on July 22, 2014 in Grabovo, Ukraine. Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 was travelling from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur when it crashed killing all 298 on board including 80 children. The aircraft was allegedly shot down by a missile and investigations continue over the perpetrators of the attack. (Photo by Rob Stothard/Getty Images)

item.title: Australia’s Liberal Opposition Elects First Female Leader
item.description: Australia’s center-right Liberal party has elected Sussan Ley as its new leader, the first woman to head the party since it was founded in 1944, taking up the task of leading the opposition back to government after a devastating election loss 10 days ago.
item.dc:creator: Ben Westcott

media:content.media:description: Sussan Ley Photographer: Louise Kennerley/Sydney Morning Herald/Getty Images

item.title: Why India and Pakistan Almost Went to War
item.description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: The increasingly intense conflict between India and Pakistan took a deadly turn in the last few weeks. Then the US surprised everyone by getting involved.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Choong Wilkins, Yang Yang, Naomi Ng

item.title: Xi Courts Latin America as Trump’s Tariffs Pressure Region
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.

item.title: Tariffs Create World Challenges, Opportunities, WTO Head Says
item.description: The global trade war with its persistent barrage of tariff developments provides both challenges and opportunities, according to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the Director General of the World Trade Organisation.

item.title: Dutertes Outperform in Philippine Midterms in Blow to Marcos
item.description: Philippine voters have delivered a blow to President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and a boost to the controversial Duterte clan, whose members and allies outperformed expectations in Monday’s midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Andreo Calonzo

item.title: Jon Voight Joins Studios, Unions to Press Trump for Film Aid
item.description: President Donald Trump’s Hollywood ambassadors joined studios, labor unions and producers in asking the White House to expand and extend tax incentives as part of an upcoming budget reconciliation bill.

item.description: Xi Jinping’s decision to stand his ground against Donald Trump could hardly have gone any better for the Chinese leader.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy, Fran Wang, Yujing Liu

item.title: Trump’s Diplomatic Frenzy Spins Big Gambles as Signs of Success
item.description: It was the kind of week that would make even a seasoned diplomat’s head spin: China trade talks, India-Pakistan truce, a ceasefire with the Houthis and Iran nuclear negotiations. Not to mention a Gaza hostage release, new trade framework with the UK and the tantalizing prospect of ending Russia’s war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Eric Martin

item.title: State Department Approves Arms Sales to UAE Before Trump’s Visit
item.description: As President Donald Trump begins a trip to the Middle East, the State Department on Monday approved about $1.4 billion in arms sales to the United Arab Emirates — the third Gulf state on his tour.
item.dc:creator: John Harney

media:content.media:description: NORTHEASTERN SYRIA - MAY 25: A U.S. Army CH-47 Chinook helicopter takes off at sunset while transporting American troops out of a remote combat outpost known as RLZ on May 25, 2021 near the Turkish border in northeastern Syria. U.S. forces, part of Task Force WARCLUB operate from combat outposts in the area, coordinating with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) in combatting residual ISIS extremists and deterring pro-Iranian militia. U.S. troops primarily use the Oshkosh M-ATV, a Mine Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) vehicle. (Photo by John Moore/Getty Images)

item.title: HK’s Best Known Activist Investor Addresses a Packed House
item.description: Members of Hong Kong’s financial community crowded into the Foreign Correspondents’ Club on Monday to hear the city’s most famous activist investor David Webb speak at what was labelled a “Farewell Fireside Chat.”
item.dc:creator: Richard Frost, Kiuyan Wong, Bei Hu

media:content.media:description: David Webb speaks to the media following the lunch event. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: New Yorkers Vow to Block House GOP Tax Bill Over SALT Limit
item.description: Two New York Republican lawmakers promised to block their party’s signature tax legislation unless GOP leaders raise a proposed $30,000 limit on the federal income tax deduction for state and local taxes.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Nacha Cattan

item.title: Can Trump Accept a Plane Gifted by Qatar?
item.description: President Donald Trump has always had strong opinions about the planes used as Air Force One, from their cost to their baby-blue color scheme. Frustrated with the growing costs and delays associated with Boeing Co.’s development of new presidential planes, Trump is turning to an unlikely alternative for his next ride: the Middle Eastern nation of Qatar, which plans to offer the president a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Korte

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump boards Air Force One at Joint Base Andrews, Maryland, on May 12.

item.title: Newark Mayor Faces 30 Days in Jail, $500 Fine Over ICE Protest
item.description: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, faces up to 30 days in jail and a $500 fine if he’s convicted of a misdemeanor charge of trespassing during a protest at a private detention facility that’s a key part of President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations.
item.dc:creator: David Voreacos

media:content.media:description: Ras Baraka speaks with ICE agents at a demonstration outside the Delaney Hall immigrant detention center in New Jersey, on May 7.

item.title: Li Ka-shing’s China Clash Unnerves Rich Investors in Hong Kong
item.description: Li Ka-shing’s strained relationship with Beijing has sent a clear reminder to Hong Kong’s tycoons and global investors eyeing the city as a wealth hub: never downplay geopolitics.
item.dc:creator: Diana Li

media:content.media:description: Li Ka-Shing Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: Lula and Xi to Ink New Deals as Brazil Shrugs Off Trump’s Trade Threats
item.description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insists he doesn’t want to pick between the US and China as his two largest trading partners wage a trade war. But it’s increasingly clear which side he’d choose if forced.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias, Leonardo Lara, Daniel Carvalho

item.title: Chief Justice Roberts Says Court Criticism Shouldn’t Be Personal
item.description: Chief Justice John Roberts said that criticism of members of the US Supreme Court shouldn’t turn personal.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Willmer

media:content.media:description: John Roberts, chief justice of the US Supreme Court, during a joint session of Congress in the House Chamber of the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, March 4, 2025. Donald Trump's primetime address Tuesday night from Capitol Hill, billed as a chronicle of his "Renewal of the American Dream," comes at a critical juncture early in his second term, as voters who elected him to tackle inflation and improve the economy are beginning to weigh the impact of his agenda.

item.title: GOP Tax Bill Prioritizes Trump Campaign Vows, Increases SALT
item.description: President Donald Trump’s campaign tax pledges — no taxes on tips and overtime pay, plus new tax breaks for car buyers and seniors — are the centerpiece of a multitrillion dollar package that will serve as Republicans’ signature legislative effort.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Ari Natter, Nancy Cook

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Saturday, May 10, 2025. The legislative push for President Donald Trump's massive tax package will begin in earnest next week as key House committees consider the legislation despite lingering divisions among Republicans. Photographer: Aaron Schwartz/Bloomberg

item.title: SALT, Tips and Auto Loans: A Guide to the House GOP Tax Bill
item.description: House Republicans’ release of the tax provisions in their massive fiscal bill provides a crucial initial reading of what party leaders think could pass, culminating weeks of intense negotiations among fractious GOP lawmakers.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Emily Birnbaum

media:content.media:description: Customers at a Ford dealership in Richmond, California, US, on Wednesday, April 16, 2025. US retail sales rose substantially in March on a jump in car purchases and other goods such as electronics, suggesting consumers were scrambling to get ahead of tariffs.

item.title: Carney Plans Economy-Focused Cabinet With Fewer Trudeau Ministers
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to unveil a new cabinet with many new faces who didn’t serve in Justin Trudeau’s inner circle, according to an official with knowledge of the matter.

item.title: Republicans Revive Drug Middlemen Reforms in Budget Bill
item.description: House Republicans revived a set of policies that would change how prescription drug middlemen do business, as President Donald Trump again denounced the industry, sending shares of some of the companies down Monday.
item.dc:creator: John Tozzi

item.description: US President Donald Trump said China had agreed to remove non-tariff barriers to US imports as he announced a deescalation of his trade war with Beijing, suggesting even greater concessions could be in store if talks progress.

item.title: Tax-Exemption on Muni Bonds ‘Untouched’ in House Tax-Cut Plan
item.description: Public finance lobbyists and bankers breathed a sigh of relief as the key federal subsidy underpinning municipal bonds appeared unscathed in a bill House tax writers released Monday.

item.title: Harvard, Yale Face Major Increase to Endowment Tax in House Plan
item.description: Republican lawmakers proposed to significantly increase taxes on the richest US universities, broadening a fight between the Trump administration and elite higher education.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Albright, Janet Lorin

media:content.media:description: A student walks through Library Walk at Yale University campus in New Haven, Connecticut, US, on Sunday April 7, 2024. A Bloomberg News analysis of more than 1,500 nonprofit four-year colleges shows the return on investment at many elite private institutions outside the eight Ivies is no better than far-less selective public universities.

item.title: White Afrikaners Arrive in US Under Revamped Refugee Program
item.description: Dozens of White Afrikaners arrived in the US from South Africa on Monday, the first beneficiaries of a controversial resettlement program that was instigated by President Donald Trump, who is meeting with South African leaders next week.
item.dc:creator: Akayla Gardner, Katlego Mtshali

media:content.media:description: The first group of Afrikaners from South Africa to arrive for resettlement listen to remarks from US Deputy Secretary of State Christopher Landau after they arrived at Washington Dulles International Airport in Dulles, Virginia, on May 12, 2025.

item.title: Albania’s Premier on Track to Win Unprecedented Fourth Term
item.description: Albania’s premier is on track to win an unprecedented fourth term as he vowed to finally take the Adriatic country into the European Union and cement its status as a tourist destination.
